headline: A Look At Honeywell International’s Valuation As Earnings Beat And Aerospace Spin Off Plans Advance
summary: Honeywell International (HON) is back in focus after reporting Q4 2025 results that surpassed expectations, raising 2026 adjusted EPS guidance and accelerating plans to spin off its Aerospace division into a dedicated avionics business. See our latest analysis for Honeywell International. At a share price of $241.38, Honeywell’s recent moves around the Aerospace spin off and raised 2026 guidance sit alongside strong momentum, with a 30 day share price return of 10.02% and a 1 year total...

headline: Honeywell Spin Off Reshapes Automation Focus And Raises Valuation Questions
summary: Honeywell International (NasdaqGS:HON) plans to spin off its Aerospace division, creating a separate avionics focused company. The move is part of an accelerated portfolio overhaul aimed at sharpening Honeywell's focus on industrial automation and related businesses. Management has highlighted the spin off timeline as a key milestone that will reshape Honeywell's business mix and industry exposure. Honeywell is known for its mix of aerospace systems, industrial automation and building...

headline: RFID Market Analysis Report 2026 - Global Forecast to 2034 with Zebra Technologies, Honeywell International, Avery Dennison, HID Global, and Datalogic Dominating
summary: The RFID market is estimated to grow from USD 14.58 billion in 2025 to USD 30.47 billion by 2034, at a CAGR of 8.5%. This growth is driven by rising demand for real-time tracking and data accuracy across retail, logistics, manufacturing, and healthcare. The contactless payments segment will register the highest CAGR, fueled by the demand for quick, secure transactions. RFID labels will lead in market share by 2034, with Asia Pacific showing the highest regional CAGR. Key players include Zebra Te
